newsitem.title: UK: German cruise ship hits container near Scilly Isles.
newsitem.headline: German cruise ship hits container near Scilly Isles.

text.p: A German cruise ship scraped a container stuck on the seabed as it left the Scilly Isles off southwestern England on Friday, coastguards said.
They said it was very unlikely the 25,000-tonne Albatross, with about 500 mainly German passengers on board, was seriously damaged but the ship returned to harbour for checks.
"The captain wants a diver to go down to check just in case. The ship bumped what we think was a container as it left the harbour this morning," a local coastguard spokesman said by telephone.
The containers were spilled from a cargo ship which sank off the Scilly Isles last month.
German media reports said the Albatross had set sail from the northern port of Bremerhaven and was on a tour of the British isles.
